item.question: Who speculated that our universe is expanding?(Ans:B)
Who had propounded the planetary laws?(Ans:B)
Who had proved first that our earth and another planet are revolving?(Ans:C)
Which one of the following elements occurs most abundantly in our universe?(Ans:A)
The stellar and solar source of energy is:(Ans:A)
The device employed to measure the diameters of stars and our galaxy (Milky Way) is called?(Ans:D)

What is the difference between asteroids and comets? I. Asteroids are small rocky planetoids, while comets are formed of frozen gases held together by rocky and metallic material. II. Asteroids are found mostly between the orbits Jupiter and Mars, while comets are found mostly between Venus and Mercury. III. Comets show a perceptible glowing tail, while asteroids do not. Which of the statements given above is/ are correct?(Ans:C)
Which of the following planets has the largest number of planets?(Ans:A)
Which one of the following planet is also called morning star or evening star?(Ans:B)
The planet which completes one revolution in 88 days around the Sun is?(Ans:A)
According to monetary policy for 2011-12 announced by RBI, the projection of money supply growth for 2011-12 is placed at(Ans:B)
Which of the following represents the budget estimates for net market borrowings by the Union government during 2011-12?(Ans:A)
According to the budget estimate of 2011-12, the plan expenditure is estimated at(Ans:C)
What is the code name given to the collective international action under UN authority to protect the Libyan people against Muammar Gaddafi’s forces?(Ans:D)

As per the Index of Government Economic Power (IGEP) 2011, released by the Ministry of Finance during Economic Survey 2010-11, what is India’s rank in the IGEP list of economy of around 112 global countries?(Ans:B)
Which of the following persons has been awarded with the prestigious Sydney Peace Prize for the year 2011?(Ans:D)
What is the name of pilot project recently launched by President Pratibha Patil which aims to empower women in rural areas through telecom services?(Ans:C)
Which among the following states retained top slot in the list of The Economic Freedom Rankings of the States of India, 2011, recently released by the Planning Commission?(Ans:B)
India’s first Titanium Sponge plant, with a capacity of 500 tonnes, recently has been inaugurated by Defence Minister AK Antony at which of the following locations?(Ans:A)
Recently PSLV-C16 rocket launched by Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) from Sriharikota. In context of space research programme, what is the expansion of term PSLV?(Ans:D)
What is the name of the disease in man arising out of Vitamin B1 deficiency ?(Ans: B)
The deficiency of which of the following group of nutrients affects the skin ?(Ans:B)
What does niacin deficiency cause ?(Ans:D)
What are the effects of Vitamin B6 deficiency ?(Ans:D)
Which of the following diseases is associated with Vitamin C deficiency ?(Ans:B)
What does Vitamin K deficiency lead to ?(Ans:B)
Using purgatives on a regular basis is harmful to health. Which deficiency does it cause ?(Ans:B)
Deficiency of Vitamin D gives rise to ?(Ans:D)
What is the condition known as, in which the body does not get its fair share of nutrients, either from starvation, or as a result of poor absorption ?(Ans:B)
Night blindness drying of the conjunctiva, dry and scaly skin and loss of hair are some of the symptoms of :(Ans:B)
